channel.title: Question about protocols
channel.description: who choses the name of a new rsps protocol? why 194, 317, 503, 508, 525, 562, 602,...? and not 499, 203, 588? and what is protocol 1, is it deviousmud?

item.title: Question about protocols
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

That depends on the client revision, The rip however is mostly random (e.g. 377, 562) however some are done on purpose (e.g. 474, 503/508, 601/602) due to the new updates (for 474 it was construction i believe, for 503/508 it was HD and for 601/602 it was dungeoneering).

edit: Revision #1 is probably runescape classic.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about protocols
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

The “protocol” I think is usually the way packets are sent client > server and server > client (player updating, talking, walking, etc.)
The numbers just state what revision and what update number it is.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about protocols
item.dc:creator: @pauline pauline
item.description:
@pauline wrote:

those numbers are the client’s revision numbers when they were put out by jagex.

Read full topic
